questions.text: Truman's famous mystery series is based in Washington DC. What is the name of the series?
questions.explanation:
Capital Crimes Series.

	She started this critically acclaimed series of murder mysteries in 1980 and through 2007 has written twenty-three different books. Her familiarity with the inner workings of the US capital gives her a unique perspective from which to write.

questions.text: In Truman's book "Murder at the Library of Congress" what historic manuscript becomes the focus of the storyline?
questions.correct: A second diary about Columbus' voyage to the New World
questions.explanation:
A second diary about Columbus' voyage to the New World.

	The main character of this book explores the world of historic manuscripts and murder while writing an article for a magazine published by the Library of Congress.

questions.text: One Truman murder mystery has the name of another national capital in its title. What capital is mentioned?
questions.explanation:
Havana.

	"Murder in Havana" (2001) uses the US embargo against Cuba, the rule of Fidel Castro and the living conditions in this island nation as a backdrop to explore a US Senator's role in an American pharmaceutical company's ploy to use a German company to get around the US embargo in order to tap in to Cuba's ant-cancer drug research. Former CIA agent Max Pauling is the main character in this Truman mystery.

questions.text: What husband and wife sleuth team appear in several of Truman's mystery novels?
questions.explanation:
Mac and Annabel Smith.

	Mac is a law professor at a local DC university and Annabel owns a gallery that specializes in Pre-Colombian art. The married couple is a central part of the Washington social scene and finds themselves deeply involved in several of Truman's storylines.

questions.text: In this non-fiction book written by Truman in 1969 you could read about "Feller, the unwanted dog".
options: Canine Heroes of World War II
questions.explanation:
White House Pets.

	"Feller" was a Cocker Spaniel that was given to the President Truman by a fellow Missourian. Not a dog lover he gave him away to his personal physician rather than raise him at the White House. Dog lovers from around the nation were upset. The dog was often referred to as "Feller, the Unwanted Dog". Margaret Truman wrote about many of the "first pets" that resided in the White House over the years.

questions.text: Who is murdered in Truman's' first published mystery novel, "Murder in the White House"?
questions.explanation:
The Secretary of State.

	Written in 1980, this was Truman's first book in her murder mystery series.

questions.text: Which two Truman mystery novels have murders occurring at the same place?
questions.correct: "Murder at the Kennedy Center" and "Murder at the Opera"
options: "Murder at Ford's Theater" and "Murder on the Stage"
"Murder at Foggy Bottom" and "Murder at the FBI"
"Murder at the National Zoo" and "Murder in the Cage"
questions.explanation:
"Murder at the Kennedy Center" and "Murder at the Opera".

	In "Murder at the Opera", published in 2006 the crime takes place while the Washington National Opera is preparing for a performance at the Kennedy Center. In "Murder at the Kennedy Center" , published in 1989, a young girl is brutally killed during a political fund raising party held at the famous venue.

questions.text: In 1956 Truman published her first book. What type of book was it?
options: A coloring book for White House guests
questions.explanation:
Her autobiography.

	"Souvenir, Margaret Truman's Own Story" was written with the help of writer and editor Margaret Cousins. In the book published by McGraw-Hill Truman told of her experiences growing up in the Midwest and how she dealt with the sudden fame of becoming a US President's daughter.

questions.text: At what fictional newspaper does one of Truman's mysterious murders occur?
questions.explanation:
The Washington Tribune.

	In "Murder at the Washington Tribune", published in 2005, a veteran news reporter seeks to revive his career and his relationships while pursuing an alleged serial killer. Truman delves into a plethora of human emotions in this particular mystery.

questions.text: What famous quote by President Truman is included in the title of one of his daughter's books?
options: Always be sincere, even if you don't mean it.
If you can't stand the heat get out of the kitchen
I never did give anybody hell. I just told the truth and they thought it was hell.
questions.explanation:
The buck stops here.

	In 1990 Truman published a collection of her father's witty sayings and musings in the book, "Where the Buck Stops: The Personal and Private Writings of Harry S Truman".  She also published "Letters from Father: The Truman Family's Personal Correspondence" published in 1983, "Harry S Truman" a biography published in 1973 and a biography about her mother Bess Truman published in 1994.
